Yesterday, 22.9.'25 I placed an online order for over €100 with SuperValu Churchtown and chose a delivery slot of 5-7 pm. When the order hadnt arrived by 8 pm I rang Customer Service who said they would pass on the message. I did not receive a phone call so I tried to contact the store by phone. However, after a brief recorded message suggesting a visit to the website the line dropped (twice). I then made contact through a bot on the website which eventually reported that the message would be passed on.This morning I received an email from SuperValu apologising for a ' a miscommunication within our department' and asking what time would suit for delivery and offering a refund of the €7 delivery charge.  As I happened to be home this morning I requested 11-12.  The delivery arrived well after 12 and I noted from their delivery note that the original time of 5-7 pm had been changed to 12-2 pm today!!The baguette and scones included in the order were intended for a person who is ill but had to be discarded due to the fact that they were not fresh. Perhaps I'm mistaken but it appears to me that the delivery had been chilled overnight which couldhave caused that.I have always found that shopping physically in that store is a pleasure but would not even consider online ordering from SuperValu Churchtown again.

Review relates to Supervalu, Grange, Cork. On positive notes, their checkout staff are absolutely lovely to deal with!Also their autism specific shopping hours are great.Negative points: Self checkouts are extremely frustrating to use.. Not once have I ever scanned a full shop without waiting around for staff due to errors on these machines! Several times, there's been no staff around these machines to help.I've had issues processing my card where the machine emits deafening beep sound that are audible all around the store!! very embarrassing!!Second issue is their price labelling. Price labels are mixed up, obscurely labelled and unclear.For example a 2euro price tag below 6 euro items.The 2 and 6 euro tags are for the same pizza brand have almost identical descriptions.This is an issue all across the store, and I feel it's done intentionally as a tactic to get customers to inadvertently purchase more expensive items...How difficult is it to align the price tags with the correct products??

I’ve been to SuperValu in Walkinstown several times and overall, I really like the store. They have a great selection of fresh bakery items, meats, and vegetables. The store is always clean, well-organized, and the staff are friendly and helpful, which makes shopping there a pleasant experience.Also I bought a pack of Takis crisps that were marked €2.50 with a rewards card, but at the self-service checkout, they scanned at €3—even after I scanned my rewards card. It’s frustrating when the shelf price doesn’t match what you’re charged. Something to watch out for.However, I was recently disappointed when I purchased a leek and cheese sandwich filler. When I got home, I noticed the seal was broken, and it looked like someone may have already taken a spoonful out of it. It was really off-putting and quite shocking to find something like that.Aside from that incident, I’ve had no other issues and still think it’s a great store. I just hope they tighten up quality control on packaged goods to avoid this happening again.

She loudly said “we speak English here” and walked off, leaving the woman helpless and the staff member speaking badly about a customer. Shocking display of ignorance and a certain attitude towards other nationalities, visibly very upsetting to a number of customers. As someone who works in retail and customer service, I will not be shopping in a store that allows such visible rudeness.

I am writing this about my experience with dealing with Musgraves - registered owners of SuperValue . I sent an email last September 2024 with my concerns , They informed me that they forwarded my concerns to the manager SuperValue  ,Kiladinny Santry. To this date nobody as contacted me. My mother is elderly , poor mobility as shopped there for years in this store . I could not believe that nobody assisted or helped her bag her few bits  of her shopping . The young personnel just seat looking pretty and no help offered . I do my mother’s shop now . It’s such a shame that their staff are not trained properly to assist those in need .

Was genuinely shocked at how unkept and unclean the shop was, how stale the fresh produce looked, how limited the variety was- even basics weren’t available.  Have no idea what target market they are aiming for?  Why anyone would shop here with the option of Dunnes down the road and Lidl next door is beyond me.A totally bleak experience! Never again.

Sent 3 complaints to them, but there were no replies. Total disgrace.
Too expensive,and constantly fiddling to get smaller products for bigger prices. Someone should really investigate the price gouging.

Food out of date since December 2024. Disgusting. Am I now to drive back to the store, pay for parking, and get a refund? The refund will be gone on fuel and parking, not to mention my time. You should be fined for selling out of date produce. You know it's not the first time.

My daughter and I did a big shop today in our local SuperValu in Ranelagh. Despite it being quite small, dingy and badly stocked, it’s our local supermarket (compare with the nice SV in Rathgar!). We used the self service till to pay for our groceries. The self service machine kept stopping saying that there was an “unexpected item in the bagging area.” This happened about 5-6 times. A man at the next till commiserated and told me he’d experienced the same malfunctioning tills at SV before. I looked for a store assistant to help. My daughter was at the till. The sales assistant waved her card at the machine, which solved the problem, but turned to my daughter and hissed, “I don’t know what the problem is, there is no problem, it’s working,” in a very rude and abrupt manner. My daughter is 21 years old, but she was quite shaken by being ridiculed. My daughter and I had been scanning our groceries together, I was witness to the decrepit faulty machine and I also witnessed the incredible behaviour of the so called “sales assistant.” Her job description is in the title of her job! She is there to assist. I don’t think the so called “sales assistant” realised that my daughter and I were together. My daughter is adopted and has dark skin. I felt there was an element of racism in her treatment of my daughter which utterly shocked me, I doubt very much she would have dared to speak to me in the same sneering tone of voice. Having said  that, at around 4:30pm the shop seemed severely understaffed. A different sales assistant was on her hands and knees trying to repair one of the self service tills, and there seemed to be no one manning the cash registers. It shows very poor management skills that the checkout section of a busy urban grocery store should be so understaffed during peak times. However, NOTHING legitimises a sales assistant sneering at and being rude to a customer. I promise that I will take the almost €100 I spent today at SV to Dunnes just up the street for our next shop.
